Controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Controller.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.HierarchyBoundsListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener, javax.swing.event.TableModelListener

    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.HierarchyBoundsListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener, javax.swing.event.TableModelListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
    The Controller class takes care of any listener methods. It listens for all changes and takes care of them. It also contains methods for parsing, loading files and retrieving cell data.

      • valueChanged

        public void valueChanged(javax.swing.event.ListSelectionEvent e)
        The valueChanged method listens to changed in the selection model of the table, when there is a change it will place the text or function from the selected cell into the textfield
        Specified by:
        valueChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

      • loadFile

        public void loadFile(java.io.File file)
        This method will take a file, use the readXML method to parse the file, then it will use the Spreadsheet list to add all the values to the Table
        Parameters:
        file - File: File to be loaded into the application

      • parseFunction

        public java.lang.String parseFunction(java.lang.String function)
        This method takes a String. It will try to parse this string into a function and, when succeeded, call the function to calculate the requested value and return it. When it fails, it will either return null, when there was no function in the first place, or it will return a string indicating that the function is not recognized.
        Parameters:
        function - String: String to be parsed

      • parseCellData

        public java.lang.String[] parseCellData(java.lang.String firstCell,
                               java.lang.String lastCell)
        ParseCellData gets two cells as parameter. It retrieves the cells' locations and then retrieves all the cells' contents that are in between the two cells specified. This is stored in a String array and returned.
        Parameters:
        firstCell - String: Sting representation of the first cell
        lastCell - String: String representation of the second cell
        Returns:
        values String[] Strings with all the cells contents
